alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:55AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Monroe, Bibb, Twiggs, Jones and Houston Counties. Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. The rapid flow increases around 50 percent from the flood stage level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EST Wednesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 10/08/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EST.
